intro: Psychotria ivorensis, commonly known as the Ivorian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria ivorensis is typically found in moist, shaded forest understories and is adapted to humid tropical climates. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native ecosystems.
